comments.commentBody: I must be really old and so square that i have turned into a triangle. I just saw Arcade Fire and they were not even worth talking about. Someone please help me out...where is the music in this?

Of the twenty best albums of all-time (according to Rolling Stone's list) only two won album of the year the year they came out. The reason no one cares about the Grammys is that they have a well-earned reputation for never getting anything right.

this blog caught me up, since I took a two hour break, and it's funny. some good laughs and observations--I agree about J Hudson, she was having none of it.

Gaga didn't overwhelm, and did sound Madonna-like, but she got me to watch.

Just a couple of questions from a newly-minted 56 year old.

Who is Jaden Smith. It's a she, right? She looks like she is about 14.

Why are people deriding Lady Gaga? She's just created this multi-million dollar schtick that's selling like hot cakes. You gotta admire her for that, if nothing more.

I'd ask why any of this attempts to pass as serious music, but I'm not sure it was much different when I was a kid. Were The Supremes, or The Four Tops much worthier? As John Lennon said, with his typical bluntness when asked about the Beatles, "We were joost a bannd, that made it reellly BIG." Enough said.

Grammy on, everyone.
DId Mick Jagger not completely upstage Barbra Streisand???
I was hoping Eminem would win Album of the Year so I could watch Babs announce another of his awards.
I'm Canadian but please Arcade Fire, turn down the floodlights!
I like that Antebellum "Need You Now" song best when it was called "Eye in the Sky" by the Alan Parsons Project.

"One word for lady gaga Performance: AWEFULL!!!"

Was this linked on Drudge?

Anyway, too many people I never heard of winning. Not cool. Gaga 2016.
I understand that an ignor Sarah Palin week is comin up at the end of the month, any chance we can have a ignor Lady GaGa decade?

There is one 2010 college quarterback who undoubtably deserves to be a top pick: Andrew Luck. And he has taken a pass and stayed at Stanford. The rest are all crapshoots, not just Newton. The top picks this year, the sureshots, will almost all be defensive linemen. Despite the clear need of many pro teams for a quarterback, none will be taken in the top five. Bank on it.

www.newyorkgritty.net
Pittsburgh, meet the chickens coming home to roost.  I really wish there wasn't crying in hockey.

@rbhays: Perhaps you were too worked up over the presence of Killer Haley (your term, not mine) to notice that it was Haley who scored a pretty nifty goal to make the score 6-0 in the second period. I'm not saying that the league shouldn't be ashamed at the way the game disintegrated, but the Pens and Lemieux are living in a glass house; Note the Crosby slew-foot on the Rangers' Ryan Callahan and, as mentioned by a number of posters above, Lemieux employing Matt Cooke. The Islanders are hardly the only team in the league with bones to pick with the Pens. They'd have to take a number after the Bruins and the Rangers, just for starters.
Speaking of the Bruins, the NHL will always be able to easily achieve joke status as long as Colin Campbell won't punish either his son or Greggy's teammates for their latest transgressions, which include Greggy cutting an opponents' face badly with his elbow pad. I, for one, wish the goonery would just...go...away
The best part of the Grammys were Barbara and Mick. the rest of the show was trash. what a waste of time

J.C. & D.I.- Thankyou! You were hysterical. It would have been such a borrrring show without you. Thanks for recognizing Jagger's fantastic performance (so far beyond those youngsters), and J.C., hope you got your dinner.

"D.I.: That's a bit of a shocker. A French acceptance speech at an American awards show?"

Given that Quebec, a province that's 80 percent french speaking, borders on the United States; this comment from Dave Itzkoff is either spectacularly ignorant, spectacularly insensitive or yet another example of the NYT's gift for supercilious irony
We need a revolution in commercial pop music!  Egyptian bloggers, please help!  This stuff is really bad.

Poor Justin Bieber. Maybe he’ll have another chance to win best New Artist, he seemed so disappointed. I hear he kept muttering Cee-Lo Green’s song title for some reason.

CEE-LO GREEN
(tune of EVERGREEN)

Loved
Loved Lady Gaga’s flair
Loved
Jada and Will’s young heir
We loved Mister Jagger too
That was some to-do

Arcade Fire
Took home the biggest prize
Loved them best
We can tell no lies
Loved
Gwyneth and Cee-Lo Green
Quite a scene, those two

Eminem made some flames start to burst
Glad he ended up winning
Katy flew, then her dance seemed odd at first
That girl does delight us
Though she is the slightest;

Loved
That Esperanza won
That’s the story, so sorry, son
Times when life is feeling rough
Times clean words are not enough
It’s tough
You can ask
Cee-Lo
Cee-Lo Green

Mumford & Sons had the best album out there, Sigh No More, but I'll settle for Arcade Fire's Suburbs.

Looks like rumors of a Stones tour might be true. Mick is certainly ready, and Charlie Watts looks game.

Let's see tonight's Grammy's proved that:

1) There's Mick Jagger, and then there's everybody else. He put in the night's best performance.
2) Bob Dylan's voice is worse than ever, as is his sneering performance. Time f/ Shadey Acres.
3) Gwenyth Paltrow can actually sing and dance, way better than most others tonight
4) Wrong women f/ awful Aretha tribute should have had Chaka Khan, Mavis Staples, CeCe Winan
5) Too much cleavage and high heels, not enough real talent on stage tonight.
At least there were some worthy winners: Arcade Fire, Muse, Them Crooked Vultures & Iron Maiden.
Thanks to Ms. Streisand for adding some class to the Grammys...she is still ageless and evergreen nearing 70 yrs young. Mick Jagger added energy and fun as well.

I was losing faith in many of the Grammy winner selections until Arcade Fire won Album of the Year.  The beautiful thing about their win was that it was not determined by album sales, popularity, or fashion.  Rather, they won based upon talent, creativity, and great melodies created through complex musical arrangements and meaningful lyrics.  Arcade Fire...you deserve this award!

I couldn't agree with virtually everyone here any more.  I'm not sure when the Grammy's faded into oblivion, but it sure seems like it was ages ago.  It seems like the final last breath that the large record companies try and advertise their non-sense "music" scene.  There are so many talented musicians out there and it is a disgraceful shame that those who are worthy do not garner any real attention for their hard work and devotion.

Mick Jagger was simply electrifying. The only part of the show I enjoyed and will remember.

Long live the Mick!!
